content: Investments Financial Planners Asked by AnonymousAsked on 21 Jul 2019Anyone tried Providend Ltd before?Saw on the papers that they are a few-only advisory firm. Thinking how it will be like, as opposed to financial advisors who typically earn fees from product providers. Anybody tried them before?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Luke Ho, Kick-Ass Financial Services Consultant at Trillion Financial PlannersLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Sep 2019I gave some of my personal thoughts here on Christopher and the company as people. Structurally and professionally, I was very impressed.You need to be of high net worth to pay for the fees, though. I can only assume you will get top quality advice because they take their end product extremely seriously - which you should since a fee is fixed regardless of affordability. You pay for results.
